title: Perfect Square Trinomials Pattern
text: The first and last terms are perfect squares but the middle term does not match $$2a b$$.
speech: The first and last terms are perfect squares but the middle term does not match  2 a b, .

title: Alternative Method
text: Factor using the "ac" method. Varibles "a" and "c" multiply out to $$144$$ and by experimenting with different combinations of the middle term we can see that $$24\times6=144$$ which comes from $$24+6=144$$.
speech: Factor using the "ac" method. Varibles "a" and "c" multiply out to  144  and by experimenting with different combinations of the middle term we can see that  24 times 6 is equal to, 144  which comes from  24, plus 6 is equal to 144 .

title: Splitting the Middle Term
text: Split the middle term into the identified numbers before: $$16r^2+24r+6r+9$$. Then factor by grouping: $$8r \left(2r+3\right)+3\left(2r+3\right)$$ which results in $$\left(8r+3\right) \left(2r+3\right)$$.
speech: Split the middle term into the identified numbers before:  16 r squared, plus 24 r plus 6 r plus 9 . Then factor by grouping:  8 r, parentheses, 2 r plus 3,  plus 3 times, parentheses, 2 r plus 3,   which results in  parentheses, 8 r plus 3,  times, parentheses, 2 r plus 3,  .
